title: Lab Manual
text: This lab manual serves as the go-to handbook for the behind-the-scenes information to support our science.

title: Github Book
text:
Github Book:

Load New Github Desktop, RStudio & R
Create your own Github Site
Use template to create a copy of this ‘book’ as a repository in your own github account.

NOAA Quarto Template to your Github Repository, following these directions
Give it an appropriate name
Make sure it is PUBLIC (necessary)

Github Desktop–> Clone repository using URL

Save to your documents–>github (use the default they provide)
See this tutorial for more info

RStudio–> New Project (top right)--> Existing Project–> navigate to your project folder in documents-> github
Understand Layout
Change names for files in contents folder
modify file that says _quarto it is a yaml file
Render
Open -site folder, click on index file, and view in web browser.
If all looks good– then github desktop commit, then push to github
Open in github, check it out.
If needed, fix mistakes or revise in RStudio, rinse, repeat

title: Introduction to Acoustics
text:
Intro to Acoustics (Anne)

title: R Markdown
text: You can include R Markdown files in your project.

title: R Markdown
text:
R Markdown
This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com.
When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

summary(cars)

     speed           dist       
 Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00  
 1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00  
 Median :15.0   Median : 36.00  
 Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98  
 3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00  
 Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

title: R Markdown
text:
Including Plots
You can also embed plots, for example:





Note that the echo = FALSE parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
